channel.title: math.AC updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.AC updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: Non-existence of Ulrich modules over Cohen-Macaulay local rings
item.description: arXiv:2403.15566v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Over a Cohen-Macaulay local ring, the minimal number of generators of a maximal Cohen-Macaulay module is bounded above by its multiplicity. In 1984 Ulrich asked whether there always exist modules for which equality holds; such modules are known nowadays as Ulrich modules. We answer this question in the negative by constructing families of two dimensional Cohen-Macaulay local rings that have no Ulrich modules. Some of these examples are Gorenstein normal domains; others are even complete intersection domains, though not normal.
item.dc:creator: Srikanth B. Iyengar, Linquan Ma, Mark E. Walker, Ziquan Zhuang

item.title: Almost Complete Intersections: Regularity of powers and Rees algebra
item.description: arXiv:2403.15844v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: An almost complete intersection ideal can be seen as a $d$-sequence ideal with the minimal number of generators being one more than its height. In this paper, we give exact formulas for the regularity of powers of graded almost complete intersection ideals. We also present the minimal bigraded free resolutions of Rees algebras associated with linear type ideals having one generator more than their grade and study the properties of Cohen-Macaualyness, Koszulness associated to their diagonals.
item.dc:creator: Neeraj Kumar, Chitra Venugopal

item.title: Unmixedness of generalized Veronese bi-type ideals
item.description: arXiv:2403.16094v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: In this paper, some algebraic invariants of generalized Veronese bi-type ideals are computed. We characterize the unmixed generalized Veronese bi-type ideals and we give a description of their associated prime ideals.
item.dc:creator: Monica La Barbiera, Roya Moghimipor

item.title: Polymatroidal property of generalized mixed product ideals
item.description: arXiv:2403.16098v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Let L be the generalized mixed product ideal induced by a monomial ideal I. In this paper, we study the polymatroidal property of generalized mixed product ideals. Furthermore, some algebraic invariants of L are computed.
item.dc:creator: Monica La Barbiera, Roya Moghimipor

item.title: Combinatorics of the integral closure of edge ideals of strong quasi-n-partite graphs
item.description: arXiv:2403.16109v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Combinatorial properties of some ideals related to strong quasi-n-partites graphs are examined. We prove that the edge ideal of a strong quasi-n-partite graph is not integrally closed and we give an expression for its integral closure. Moreover, we are able to determine the structure of the ideals of vertex covers for the edge ideals associated to a strong quasi-n-partite graph.
item.dc:creator: Monica La Barbiera, Roya Moghimipor

item.title: Combinatorial properties of strong quasi-n-partite graphs
item.description: arXiv:2403.16114v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Monomial ideals corresponding to strong quasi-n-partite graphs are considered. Some algebraic and combinatorial properties of generalized graph ideals of a strong quasi-n-partite graph are studied. Furthermore, we show that the edge ideal of a strong quasi-n-partite graph is Cohen-Macaulay.
item.dc:creator: Monica La Barbiera, Roya Moghimipor

item.title: Minimal Cellular Resolutions of Path Ideals
item.description: arXiv:2403.16324v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: In this paper, we prove that the path ideals of both paths and cycles have minimal cellular resolutions. Specifically, these minimal free resolutions coincide with the Barile-Macchia resolutions for paths, and their generalized counterparts for cycles. Our result on cycles marks the first instance in the literature where the minimal free resolution of edge ideals of cycles has been established. Furthermore, edge ideals of cycles represent the first class of ideals that lack a minimal Barile-Macchia resolution, yet have a minimal generalized Barile-Macchia resolution.
item.dc:creator: Trung Chau, Selvi Kara, Kyle Wang

item.title: Deep Points of Cluster Algebras
item.description: arXiv:2403.15589v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: We initiate a systematic study of the deep points of a cluster algebra; that is, the points in the associated variety which are not in any cluster torus. We describe the deep points of cluster algebras of type A, rank 2, Markov, and unpunctured surface type.
item.dc:creator: James Beyer, Greg Muller

item.title: Maximal Number of Skew Lines in the Fermat Surface
item.description: arXiv:2403.15666v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: It is well-known that the Fermat surface of degree $d\geq 3$ has $3d^2$ lines. However, it has not yet been established what is the maximum number of pairwise disjoint lines that it can have if $d\geq 4$. In this article we show that the maximal number of skew lines on the Fermat surface of degree $d \geq 4$ is $3d$ either $d$ even or $d$ odd distinct of $5$, otherwise ($d = 5$) it contains no more than $13$ pairwise disjoint lines.
item.dc:creator: Sally Andria, Jacqueline Rojas, W\'allace Mangueira

item.title: On containment of trace ideals in ideals of finite homological dimension
item.description: arXiv:2312.01230v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: Motivated by recent result of P\'erez and R.G. on equality of test ideal of module closure operation and trace ideal, and the well-known result by Smith that parameter test ideal cannot be contained in parameter ideals, we study the obstruction of containment of trace ideals in ideals of finite projective (or injective) dimension. One of our results says that the trace ideal of any big Cohen--Macaulay module over a Gorenstein complete local domain cannot be contained in any ideal of finite projective dimension, thereby generalizing Smith's result in this case. As consequences of our results, we give upper bounds on $\mathfrak m$-adic order of trace ideals of certain modules over local Cohen--Macaulay rings. We also prove analogous results for ideal of entries of maps in a free resolution of modules.
item.dc:creator: Souvik Dey, Monalisa Dutta

item.title: Asymptotic behaviour of integer programming and the $\text{v}$-function of a graded filtration
item.description: arXiv:2403.08435v4 Announce Type: replace Abstract: The $\text{v}$-function of a graded filtration $\mathcal{I}=\{I_{[k]}\}_{k\ge0}$ is introduced. Under the assumption that $\mathcal{I}$ is Noetherian, we prove that the $\text{v}$-function $\text{v}(I_{[k]})$ is an eventually quasi-linear function. This result applies to several situations, including ordinary powers, and integral closures of ordinary powers, among others. As another application, we investigate the asymptotic behaviour of certain integer programming problems. Finally, we present the Macaulay2 package $\texttt{VNumber}$.
item.dc:creator: Antonino Ficarra, Emanuele Sgroi

item.title: $v$-numbers of filtrations of homogeneous ideals
item.description: arXiv:2403.09175v4 Announce Type: replace Abstract: We extend the notion of $v$-number and local $v$-number of a homogeneous ideal for Noetherian filtrations of homogeneous ideals in a Noetherian $\mathbb N$-graded domain. We consider integral closure filtrations, generalized symbolic power filtrations and filtrations of valuation ideals. We show that $v$-number and local $v$-number of these filtrations are quasi-linear type and $\displaystyle\lim\limits_{n\to\infty}\frac{v_\mathfrak p(I_n)}{n}$ exists. We explicitly compute $v$-numbers of symbolic powers of cover ideals of cycles, complete graphs and complete bipartite graphs. We show that they are bounded by the Castelnuovo-Mumford regularity of those ideals. For any positive integer $k$, we provide monomial ideals $I_k$ and $J_k$ associated to a $3$-cycle such that reg$(I_k)-v(I_k)=k$ and reg$(R/J_k)-v(J_k)=k$. We show that for the cover ideal $J$ of a complete graph, reg$(R/J^{(n)})=v(J^{(n)})$ for $n=1,2$. We provide a squarefree monomial ideal $J$ such that reg$(R/J^{(n)})=v(J^{(n)})$ for all $n\geq 1$.
item.dc:creator: Vanmathi A, Parangama Sarkar

item.title: Quasi-F-splittings in birational geometry II
item.description: arXiv:2302.13235v3 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: Over an algebraically closed field of characteristic $p>41$, we prove that three-dimensional $\mathbb Q$-factorial affine klt varieties are quasi-$F$-split. Furthermore, we show that the bound on the characteristic is optimal.
item.dc:creator: Tatsuro Kawakami, Teppei Takamatsu, Hiromu Tanaka, Jakub Witaszek, Fuetaro Yobuko, Shou Yoshikawa

item.title: On m-tuples of nilpotent 2x2 matrices over an arbitrary field
item.description: arXiv:2310.00477v3 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: The algebra of ${\rm GL}_n$-invariants of $m$-tuples of $n\times n$ matrices with respect to the action by simultaneous conjugation is a classical topic in case of infinite base field. On the other hand, in case of a finite field generators of polynomial invariants even in case of a pair of $2\times 2$ matrices are not known. Working over an arbitrary field we classified all ${\rm GL}_2$-orbits on $m$-tuples of $2\times 2$ nilpotent matrices for all $m>0$. As a consequence, we obtained a minimal separating set for the algebra of ${\rm GL}_2$-invariant polynomial functions of $m$-tuples of $2\times 2$ nilpotent matrices. We also described the least possible number of elements of a separating set for an algebra of invariant polynomial functions over a finite field.
item.dc:creator: Artem Lopatin
